munchlax.lib.channel module¶

class munchlax.lib.channel.Channel(slack, channel)[source]¶

Bases: munchlax.lib.object.Object

archive()[source]¶

Archives the channel.

Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
get_history(**kwargs)[source]¶

Fetches and returns the message history for the channel.

Parameters:
  • **kwargs – Arbitrary options to use when fetching
  • channel's message history. Refer to Slack#get_channel_history (the) –
  • more information. (for) –
  • is mostly a convenience method so you can directly fetch (This) –
  • channel's message history. (a) –
Returns:

A list of Message objects. bool: Whether or not there are more messages in the channel’s history.
Return type:

list (Message)
Raises:

SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
get_replies(ts)[source]¶

Fetches and returns all replies to a message within the channel.

Parameters:ts – The timestamp of the parent message to look for.
Returns:
A list of Message objects representing a message
thread.
Return type:list (Message)
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
invite_user(user)[source]¶

Invites a user to the channel.

Parameters:user (User) – The user to invite to the channel.
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
join()[source]¶

Joins the channel.

In the event that the channel is already joined, then True is returned instead of a Channel object for the joined channel.

Parameters:channel (Channel) – The channel to join. This channel must not be private.
Returns:
If the user has not yet joined this channel
then a Channel object representing the newly joined channel will be returned.

If the channel to join has already been joined, then True will be returned instead.
Return type:Channel
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
kick_user(user)[source]¶

Kicks a user from the channel.

Parameters:user (User) – The user to kick from the channel.
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
leave()[source]¶

Leaves the channel.

Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
list_members()[source]¶

Fetches and returns a list of all channel members.

Returns:All members in the channel.
Return type:list<Member>
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
mark(ts)[source]¶

Changes the last-read indicator in the channel for the current user.

Parameters:ts (float) – The timestamp to use when changing the last-read indicator.
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
rename(name, validate=False)[source]¶

Renames the channel to something else.

This method causes the current Channel object to become stale.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – The new name for the channel.
  • validate (bool) –

    Whether or not to return an error instead of changing the new name to be valid.

    Defaults to False.
Returns:

The new name for the channel.
Return type:

str
Raises:

SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
set_purpose(purpose)[source]¶

Sets the purpose for the channel.

This causes the Channel object being worked on to become stale.

Parameters:purpose – The purpose to use when updating the channel.
Returns:The new purpose of the channel.
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
set_topic(topic)[source]¶

Sets the topic for the channel.

This causes the Channel object being worked on to become stale.

Parameters:topic – The topic to use when updating the channel.
Returns:The new topic of the channel.
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
unarchive()[source]¶

Unarchives the channel.

Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
update()[source]¶

Updates the current Channel object.

There isn’t much benefit to using this and it’s here if you don’t want to replace your current Channel object or can’t.

Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
upload(**kwargs)[source]¶

Uploads a file to the channel.

Parameters:**kwargs –

Arbitrary options to use when uploading the file. Refer to Slack#upload_file for more information.

This is mostly a convenience method so you can directly upload files through a Channel object.
Returns:A File object representing the newly uploaded file.
Return type:File
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
write(text, **kwargs)[source]¶

Writes a message to the channel.

Parameters:
  • text (str) – The text of the message.
  • Additional options to use when sending the (**kwargs;) –

    message. Refer to Slack#raw_write for more information.

    In most cases, you will only need to specify text if you only want to send a text message.
Returns:

A Message object representing the newly sent message.
Return type:

Message
Raise:
SlackError: Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
